intro: Maccraithea sophronites, commonly known as the rock rose, is a species of flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, where it typically grows in rocky or coastal environments. The plant produces clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, evergreen leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Maccraithea sophronites is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging landscapes.
